title: 1D kinematics - free fall acceleration on planets

content.question: The graphs represent the speed of a ball thrown downward as a function of time near the surface of two planets. Which of the following correctly relates the acceleration <math alttext="a sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> of the ball near the surface of Planet <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and the acceleration <math alttext="a sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> of the ball near the surface of Planet <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="a sub 1 is greater than a sub 2, which is greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="a sub 2 is greater than a sub 1, which is greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, a sub 1 equals a sub 2, close parenthesis, is greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="a sub 1 equals a sub 2, which equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="a sub 1 is greater than a sub 2, which is greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
